title: Man's Search for Meaning
author: Viktor Frankl
favoriteQuote: Everything can be taken from a man but one thing: the last of the human freedoms—to choose one's attitude in any given set of circumstances.
faizReview: Its a good book but its kinda depressing which is expected , the raw human characters are shown but the life lessons are already told many times in other books, so not that impactful for me.

title: The Bed of Procrustes
author: Nassim Nicholas Taleb
favoriteQuote: The three most harmful addictions are heroin, carbohydrates, and a monthly salary.
faizReview: Amazing thoughts and that defies conventional wisdom. Though his proper books are better since its direct to the lessons.

title: When Breath Becomes Air
author: Paul Kalanithi
favoriteQuote: Even if I’m dying, until I actually die, I am still living.
faizReview: Good book but not that great , author tries too hard to be philosophical which sometimes feels forced. Though the i got to know a lot about doctors with this book

title: Sapiens
author: Yuval Noah Harari
favoriteQuote: You could never convince a monkey to give you a banana by promising him limitless bananas after death in monkey heaven.
faizReview: It shatters many faiths and beliefs and changes how i see the world. But he is a bit too pessimistic about the future of humanity, and makes up a lot of things. But overall its a great book.

title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
author: Douglas Adams
favoriteQuote: The answer to the ultimate question of life, the universe, and everything is 42.
faizReview: My favorite book currently, its amazing and it obviously increases my sense of humour. Humour and Philosophy are combined in a way that makes you laugh and think at the same time. The absurdity of life is captured perfectly.

title: Understanding Comics
author: Scott McCloud
favoriteQuote: Comics is a medium where the reader is a willing and conscious collaborator and closure is the agent of change, time and motion.
faizReview: Eye-opening exploration of visual storytelling. Changed how I think about communication and design.

title: East of Eden
author: John Steinbeck
favoriteQuote: And now that you don’t have to be perfect, you can be good.
faizReview: It consists of all types of human characters, its so so well written, i read it continuously for 4 days, its contains love, guilt, sin. My favorite character was Samuel Hamilton.

title: The Prophet
author: Kahlil Gibran
favoriteQuote: Your pain is the breaking of the shell that encloses your understanding.
faizReview: Timeless poetry and wisdom. Gibran's words on love, work, and life resonate across cultures and generations.

title: Antifragile
author: Nassim Nicholas Taleb
favoriteQuote: Some things benefit from shocks; they thrive and grow when exposed to volatility, randomness, disorder, and stressors.
faizReview: Revolutionary concept that changed how I think about uncertainty and resilience. Taleb's insights are profound.

title: The Almanack of Naval Ravikant
author: Eric Jorgenson
favoriteQuote: Seek wealth, not money or status. Wealth is having assets that earn while you sleep.
faizReview: Distilled wisdom on wealth and happiness. Naval's insights are practical and philosophically deep.

title: The Courage to Be Disliked
author: Ichiro Kishimi & Fumitake Koga
favoriteQuote: The courage to be happy also includes the courage to be disliked.
faizReview: Eye-opening exploration of Adlerian psychology. Challenges conventional thinking about relationships and self-worth.

title: The Prince
author: Niccolò Machiavelli
favoriteQuote: It is better to be feared than loved, if you cannot be both.
faizReview: Timeless political philosophy. Machiavelli's pragmatic approach to power and leadership remains relevant.

title: Refactoring UI
author: Adam Wathan & Steve Schoger
favoriteQuote: Good design is less about learning to be a great artist and more about developing an eye for spotting problems and knowing how to fix them.
faizReview: Game-changer for developers. Practical design wisdom that instantly elevates the quality of any UI you build.

title: The Book of Secrets
author: Deepak Chopra
favoriteQuote: The secret of health for both mind and body is not to mourn for the past, worry about the future, but to live in the present moment wisely and earnestly.
faizReview: Spiritual insights that bridge ancient wisdom and modern understanding. Chopra's approach to consciousness is thought-provoking.

title: Homo Deus
author: Yuval Noah Harari
favoriteQuote: History began when humans invented gods, and will end when humans become gods.
faizReview: Bold exploration of humanity's future. Harari's vision of where technology and biology intersect is both fascinating and cautionary.

title: Show Your Work!
author: Austin Kleon
favoriteQuote: Don't worry about people stealing your ideas. If your ideas are any good, you'll have to ram them down people's throats.
faizReview: Perfect companion to creative work. Kleon makes sharing your process feel natural and necessary.

title: The Psychology of Money
author: Morgan Housel
favoriteQuote: Your personal experiences with money make up maybe 0.00000001% of what's happened in the world, but maybe 80% of how you think the world works.
faizReview: Brilliant insights into financial behavior. More about human psychology than money itself.

title: Storyworthy
author: Matthew Dicks
favoriteQuote: Every story must contain a five-second moment of meaningful change.
faizReview: Masterclass in storytelling. Dicks breaks down the art of compelling narratives beautifully.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
favoriteQuote: And, when you want something, all the universe conspires in helping you to achieve it.
faizReview: A timeless fable about following your dreams. Simple yet profound wisdom about life's journey.

title: Rich Dad Poor Dad
author: Robert Kiyosaki
favoriteQuote: The poor and middle class work for money. The rich have money work for them.
faizReview: Shifted my perspective on money and investing. Not perfect, but contains valuable mindset changes.

title: Think and Grow Rich
author: Napoleon Hill
favoriteQuote: Whatever the mind can conceive and believe, it can achieve.
faizReview: Classic self-help that still holds up. Hill's principles about success and mindset are timeless.

title: How to Win Friends and Influence People
author: Dale Carnegie
favoriteQuote: You can make more friends in two months by becoming interested in other people than you can in two years by trying to get other people interested in you.
faizReview: Essential people skills manual. Carnegie's advice is as relevant today as it was decades ago.

title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a F*ck
author: Mark Manson
favoriteQuote: You and everyone you know are going to be dead soon. And in the short amount of time between here and there, you have a limited amount of fucks to give.
faizReview: Refreshingly honest take on self-help. Manson cuts through the BS with humor and wisdom.

title: The Animator's Survival Kit
author: Richard Williams
favoriteQuote: Animation is not the art of drawings that move but the art of movements that are drawn.
faizReview: The bible of animation. Williams breaks down movement in ways that apply beyond animation.

title: Figure Drawing for All It's Worth
author: Andrew Loomis
favoriteQuote: The best way to learn to draw is to draw, draw, draw.
faizReview: Loomis is the master of figure drawing. Technical excellence made accessible and inspiring.
